default.title: Readiness checklist
default.intro: Coaching works best when you can bring honest context and experiment between sessions. Use this checklist to sense whether now is a good moment to start.

sections.title: You will get the most value if
items: You can make space every fortnight to pause and reflect.
You are willing to surface the assumptions that keep you stuck.
You have a goal, decision or transition that matters this season.
You are open to trying small experiments between sessions.

sections.title: You might not be ready if
items: You need urgent therapeutic, medical or legal support before you can focus on work decisions.
Immediate needs like housing, food, or safety require all of your attention right now.
You cannot yet protect 60 minutes every few weeks for yourself without harm to your wellbeing.
You are looking for prescriptive advice rather than collaborative experimentation.

sections.title: What you can expect from us
items: Provocative questions that bring clarity without judgement.
Tools and rituals to protect your energy while you grow.
Written notes within 24 hours so insights do not get lost.
Light accountability that keeps commitments visible.

signals: If you are in acute crisis or worried about harm, contact your GP, Samaritans (116 123) or emergency services before continuing with coaching.
We pause coaching and point you to therapists, legal advisors or safeguarding teams whenever another professional is better placed to help.
When organisational sponsorship is involved, we agree confidentiality boundaries and reporting rhythms together.
Students and job seekers can request reduced-fee places or asynchronous check-ins if finances are a barrier.

career-return.intro: Come ready to talk about your values, the caregiving realities you hold and the professional identity you want to reclaim.
signals: It is okay if you feel rusty â€” we use storytelling to rebuild confidence step by step.
Expect to experiment with boundaries that protect both your work and your care roles.

sections.title: Bring questions like
items: How do I translate feedback into next steps without overworking?
What rhythms will help me leave work at work?
How do I advocate for myself without feeling performative?

sections.title: We will focus on
items: Building repeatable weekly check-ins and reviews.
Naming your strengths so you can communicate them with clarity.
Practising conversations with managers or mentors before they happen.

immigrant-job.intro: Readiness often looks like collecting stories from across cultures and industries. Bring the experiences that shaped you, not just your CV.
signals: Expect time to co-create language that makes sense across cultures.
We will signpost to practical job search resources when coaching is not the right lever.
